blog.content: Choosing a health plan can be complicated. We can help you understand how to compare Marketplace plans and choose one that’s right for you. Here are some important things to consider when choosing a plan: - **[Plan category:](/how-do-i-choose-marketplace-insurance/#part=2)** There are 5 categories of Marketplace insurance plans: Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, and Catastrophic. The health plan category you choose determines how you and your plan share the costs of care. - **[Monthly premiums:](/how-do-i-choose-marketplace-insurance/#part=3)** This is the amount you pay your insurance company for your plan whether you use medical services or not. Monthly premiums are important, but they’re not all you need to think about. - **[Out-of-pocket costs:](/how-do-i-choose-marketplace-insurance/#part=4)** It’s important to know how much you have to pay out of your pocket for services when you get care. You pay these out-of-pocket costs in addition to your monthly premiums. - **[Type of insurance plan and provider network:](/how-do-i-choose-marketplace-insurance/#part=5)** Different plan types provide different levels of coverage for care you get inside and outside of the plan’s network of doctors, hospitals, pharmacies, and other medical service providers. - **[Benefits:](/how-do-i-choose-marketplace-insurance/#part=6)** All plans sold through the Marketplace provide the same essential health benefits, cover pre-existing conditions and offer free preventive services. Now that you know what to look for you can [preview plans and prices in your area](https://www.healthcare.gov/find-premium-estimates) and [apply online](https://www.healthcare.gov/marketplace/b/welcome/). It takes most people 20 minutes or less to apply. **But remember that you only have a few days left to enroll in 2014 coverage – open enrollment ends March 31.**

blog.title: #Asegurate por estas 6 razones
blog.meta-title: #Asegurate por estas 6 razones
blog.meta-description: Aquí hay 6 razones para inscribirse en un plan médico en el Mercado de Seguros Médicos.
blog.seo-keywords: Mercado de los Seguros Médicos,
blog.excerpt: Aquí hay 6 razones para inscribirse en un plan médico en el Mercado de Seguros Médicos.
blog.content:
Aquí hay 6 razones para inscribirse en un plan médico en el Mercado de Seguros Médicos.

1.	Se acaba el tiempo para inscribirse. El 31de marzo es su última oportunidad para inscribirse en la cobertura del 2014. Si no se inscribe, tendrá que pagar el costo total de todo su cuidado médico durante 2014. Y la mayoría de las personas no tendrán otra oportunidad hasta noviembre para inscribirse. No espere. [¡Inscríbase hoy!](https://www.cuidadodesalud.gov/marketplace/b/#welcome/)

2.	Vale la pena tener paz y tranquilidad. Aproximadamente 6 de cada 10 estadounidenses sin seguro podrían pagar menos de $100 al mes por la cobertura del Mercado. Es posible encontrar un seguro de salud por el bajo precio de $50 al mes. [Vea lo que puede ahorrar](https://www.cuidadodesalud.gov/es/find-premium-estimates/). 

3.	Solicitar es más fácil que nunca. Hemos mejorado la experiencia para nuestros consumidores simplificando el proceso de [crear una cuenta](https://www.cuidadodesalud.gov/marketplace/b/#welcome/b), publicando nuevo contenido y [consejos prácticos](/es/how-to-have-the-best-experience-with-healthcare-gov/) para usar el Mercado de seguros, aumentando la capacidad del sistema y añadiendo más representantes de servicio al cliente.
<!--more-->
4.	Usted puede ahorrar más con un plan de categoría Plata. La reducción de costos compartidos del Mercado reduce la cantidad que tiene que pagar por [gastos directos de su bolsillo](/es/glossary/out-of-pocket-costs "glossary") como deducibles, copagos y coseguro. Sus ahorros se basan en sus ingresos y tamaño de la familia. Si califica, los [ahorros en los gastos directos de su bolsillo](/es/will-i-qualify-to-save-on-out-of-pocket-costs/) sólo serán posibles con un plan de Plata.

5.	Usted elige como usar sus ahorros. Si califica para un crédito fiscal anticipado para la prima tiene que decidir cómo usar el crédito. Puede aplicar parte o todo su crédito para [reducir su prima mensual](/es/will-i-qualify-to-save-on-monthly-premiums/). O simplemente puede obtener un reembolso en la declaración de impuestos del próximo año.

6.	Mejor cobertura. Mejores beneficios. Todos los planes de salud privados que se ofrecen en el Mercado de seguros ofrecen el mismo conjunto de [beneficios de salud esenciales](/es/glossary/essential-health-benefits "glossary"). Exámenes, vacunas y otros [servicios preventivos](/es/what-are-my-preventive-care-benefits/) están cubiertos sin necesidad de pagar el [deducible](/es/glossary/deductible "glossary"). Muchos planes también cubren otros beneficios como las visitas al médico y medicamentos recetados, aun si no ha cumplido con su deducible.

Millones de estadounidenses [como Lizelle ya se benefician](/es/connect/) de la cobertura accesible y de calidad a su disposición a través del Mercado.

No pierda la oportunidad. [#Asegurate](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23Asegurate&src=hash).

blog.title: 6 more reasons to #GetCovered
blog.meta-title: 6 more reasons to #GetCovered
blog.meta-description: Here are 6 reasons to enroll in Marketplace coverage. Open enrollment ends on March 31.
blog.seo-keywords: Health Insurance Marketplace, health insurance, health coverage, open enrollment, Marketplace coverage,
blog.page_name: 6 more reasons to #GetCovered
blog.excerpt: Last month, we gave you 6 reasons to #GetCovered. And last week, President Obama and Zach Galifianakis showed you that young people aren’t invincible or invisible.
blog.content:
Last month, we gave you [6 reasons to #GetCovered](http://www.hhs.gov/healthcare/facts/blog/2014/02/six-reasons-you-should-get-covered.html). And last week, President Obama and Zach Galifianakis showed you that [young people aren’t invincible](http://www.whitehouse.gov/blog/2014/03/11/watch-president-obama-between-two-ferns-zach-galifianakis) or invisible.

Here are 6 more reasons to enroll in Marketplace coverage:
<!--more-->
**1. Time is running out.** March 31 is your last chance to enroll for 2014 coverage. If you don’t enroll, you’ll have to pay for the entire cost of all your medical care in 2014. And most people won’t get another chance to enroll until November. Don’t delay. [Enroll today!](https://www.healthcare.gov/marketplace/b/welcome/)

**2. Your peace of mind is worth it.** Nearly 6 in 10 uninsured Americans can pay less than $100 per month for Marketplace coverage. 2/3 of uninsured young adults can pay less than $100 per month. You may even find health insurance for as little as $50 per month. [See what you can save](https://www.healthcare.gov/find-premium-estimates/). 

**3. Applying is easier than ever.** We’ve improved the consumer experience by streamlining [account creation](https://www.healthcare.gov/marketplace/b/welcome/), publishing new help text and [Marketplace tips](/how-to-have-the-best-experience-with-healthcare-gov/), increasing system capacity, and adding more customer service reps.

**4. You could save more with a Silver plan.** The Marketplace cost-sharing reduction lowers the amount you have to pay for [out-of-pocket costs](/glossary/out-of-pocket-costs "glossary") like deductibles, coinsurance, and copayments. Your savings are based on your income and family size. If you qualify, you can [get these savings on out-of-pocket costs](/will-i-qualify-to-save-on-out-of-pocket-costs/) only with a Silver plan.

**5. You choose how to use your savings.** If you qualify for premium tax credits you get to decide how to apply it. You can apply all or some of your premium tax credit to [lower your monthly premium](/will-i-qualify-to-save-on-monthly-premiums/). Or you can simply get the money refunded on next year’s tax return.

**6. Better coverage. Better benefits.** All private health insurance plans offered in the Marketplace offer the same set of [essential health benefits](/glossary/essential-health-benefits "glossary"). Screenings, immunizations, and other [preventive services](/what-are-my-preventive-care-benefits) are covered without requiring you to pay your [deductible](/glossary/deductible "glossary"). Many health insurance plans also cover other benefits like doctor visits and prescription drugs even if you haven’t met your deductible.

Millions of Americans like [Lizelle, LaNika, and Lawrence are already benefiting](https://www.healthcare.gov/connect/) from the quality, affordable health coverage available to them through the Marketplace.

Don’t miss your opportunity to [#GetCovered](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23GetCovered&f=realtime).

blog.content:
A medida que nos acercamos a las últimas semanas del período de inscripción abierta, CuidadoDeSalud.gov y Healthcare.gov está listo para servirle. Todos merecemos la seguridad y tranquilidad de tener cobertura médica con la que podemos contar cuando más la necesitamos. Y seguimos haciendo el proceso de solicitud fácil para usted.

**[Para inscribirse en línea, haga clic aquí y escoja su estado.](https://www.cuidadodesalud.gov/marketplace/b/welcome/)** 

Estas son algunas maneras en la que hemos mejorado la experiencia para nuestros consumidores. Especialmente, prestándole atención a las situaciones familiares complejas con las que los miembros de la comunidad de inmigrantes se pueden encontrar, en particular:
<!--more-->
-	[Simplificamos el proceso de crear una cuenta](https://www.cuidadodesalud.gov/marketplace/b/welcome/) y arreglamos los fallos que causaban errores en la verificación de identidad y estatus de inmigración durante el proceso de solicitud (errores en la pantalla de color amarillo) – eliminando estos errores en más de un 90% de los casos.
-	[Mejoras en el proceso de solicitud y verificación de documentos de inmigración](/es/help/immigration-document-types/).
-	[Mejoras en la explicación acerca del número y tipos de documentos que puede usar para el proceso de verificación de identidad](http://marketplace.cms.gov/getofficialresources/spanish-materials/id-proofing-spanish.pdf); y el proceso por el cual puede recibir las actualizaciones de solicitudes pendientes.
-	[Nuevos consejos prácticos para ayudarle con su inscripción](http://marketplace.cms.gov/getofficialresources/spanish-materials/helping-naturalized-citizens-apply-spanish.pdf). 
-	[Servicio al cliente las 24 horas al día, 7 días de la semana](/es/contact-us/); y ayuda en 150 idiomas cuando llame al 1-800-318-2596; con asistencia adicional en español y representantes especialmente entrenados para manejar situaciones de familias inmigrantes.
-	[Ayuda personalizada disponible localmente](https://ayudalocal.cuidadodesalud.gov/es/); con personal bilingüe especializado y ayuda en cientos de ubicaciones en todo el país. Esto incluye centros de salud comunitarios que están operando con un horario extendido durante el mes de marzo.

Sabemos que muchas de las familias inmigrantes son de un  "estatus mixto", con miembros que tienen un estatus diferente de inmigración y ciudadanía. Algunas familias pueden tener miembros contribuyentes que no pueden comprar un seguro médico a través del Mercado de seguros, junto con otros familiares, cómo los inmigrantes legales, que son elegibles para usar el Mercado.

La información que nos brinde y su estatus legal se usarán sólo para verificar el proceso de inscripción en el Mercado de seguros y los programas de ayuda para los cuáles puede ser elegible; [no para propósitos de control migratorio](http://www.laopinion.com/opinion-columna-dejando-las-cosas-claras) ([Vea “Clarificación de prácticas existentes relacionadas a algunas informaciones del cuidado de la salud”](http://www.ice.gov/espanol/factsheets/aca-memoSP.htm)). [Aprenda más sobre cómo utilizamos sus datos](/es/help/learn-more-about-your-data/).

Le recomendamos que solicite cobertura médica a través del Mercado de seguros y obtenga cobertura para las personas en su familia que son elegibles. La información personal en su solicitud del Mercado de seguros no afectará su elegibilidad de inmigración. El obtener un seguro médico - y usar la cobertura médica que esta ley tan importante le extiende a las personas elegibles – [no evitará que las personas indocumentadas en su familia obtengan una tarjeta verde](http://www.uscis.gov/es/tarjeta-verde/tramite-y-procedimientos-para-la-tarjeta-verde/carga-publica) en el futuro ni pondrá en riesgo a los que todavía no tienen una. 

Con nuestros muchos [socios en las comunidades](https://ayudalocal.cuidadodesalud.gov/es/) a través de todo el país, nos comprometemos a que obtenga la cobertura médica de calidad que necesita a un precio razonable. Recuerde, su última oportunidad de inscribirse para la cobertura del 2014 es el 31 de marzo. No deje pasar esta oportunidad de obtener cobertura médica para usted y su familia.

**No queremos que pierda la oportunidad de obtener cobertura médica accesible lo antes posible. Su última oportunidad de inscribirse para la cobertura del 2014 es el 31 de marzo.**

<!--more-->
-	[Made account creation easier](https://www.healthcare.gov/marketplace/b/welcome/) and fixed bugs that were causing identity and immigration status verification errors during the application process (yellow screen errors) – eliminating these in more than 90% of cases.
-	[Improved application and better support for immigration document verification](/help/immigration-document-types/). 
-	[Clarified the number and type of documents that can be used for identify verification purposes](http://marketplace.cms.gov/getofficialresources/publications-and-articles/your-marketplace-application.pdf) and the process by which updates can be received on pending applications. 
-	[New online tips to help you enroll](http://marketplace.cms.gov/help-us/helping-naturalized-citizens-apply.pdf).
-	[24/7 customer service and assistance in 150 languages at 1-800-318-2596](/contact-us/); with additional capacity in Spanish and representatives specially trained to handle immigrant family situations.
-	[Personal help available where you live](https://localhelp.healthcare.gov/); with trained bilingual staff and support at hundreds of locations across the country. This includes community health centers which are operating with extended hours for the month of March.

We know that many immigrant families are of “mixed status,” with members having different immigration and citizenship statuses. Some families may have members who can’t buy health insurance through the Marketplace, alongside other family members who are eligible to use the Marketplace, like lawfully present immigrants.  

Any information collected through the application process for the applicant and non-applicant [will not be used for immigration enforcement purposes](http://www.ice.gov/doclib/ero-outreach/pdf/ice-aca-memo.pdf). We will verify your lawfully present status only to check what health insurance programs you may be eligible for and to process your Marketplace enrollment. [Learn more about how we use your data](/help/learn-more-about-your-data/).

We encourage you to apply for health coverage and get coverage for those in your family that are eligible. Personal information in your Marketplace application won’t affect your immigration status. Enrolling in health coverage – and using the health insurance that this important law extends to eligible individuals – [will not prevent your loved ones who are undocumented from getting a green card](http://www.uscis.gov/green-card/green-card-processes-and-procedures/public-charge) in the future or who do not yet have a green card at risk.  

With our many [partners in communities](https://localhelp.healthcare.gov/) across the country, we're committed to making sure you get the quality, affordable health coverage you need. Remember, your last chance to enroll for 2014 coverage is March 31. Don’t let this important opportunity for affordable health care for you or members of your family pass.

**We don't want you to miss your opportunity to get affordable health coverage as soon as possible. Your last chance to enroll for 2014 coverage is March 31.**

## [Thursday, February 27: Ready to serve millions more](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2014/02/ready-to-serve-millions-more.html)
<!--more-->
As we head into the final weeks of open enrollment, HealthCare.gov is working and ready to serve you. Hundreds of thousands of visitors are coming to the site every day to shop for coverage. And we continue to add new enhancements to streamline the application process.

[Read more about how we are continuing to improve HealthCare.gov...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2014/02/ready-to-serve-millions-more.html)

## [Thursday, February 13: Upcoming system maintenance at Social Security](/blog/want-coverage-starting-march-1-plan-ahead-for-best-results/) 
  
Our online application uses a Data Services Hub to “talk to” other data systems to verify information that you enter. One of these systems belongs to the Social Security Administration, which verifies Social Security Numbers and other related data.  From Saturday February 15, 2014 at 3:00 p.m. until Tuesday, February 18, 2014 at 5:00 a.m. EST, the Social Security Administration will conduct required, regularly scheduled systems maintenance activities. During this period, you won’t be able to submit an application at HealthCare.gov and find out what you are eligible for. If you are trying to enroll by the February 15 deadline for coverage beginning March 1, you should try to submit your application before 3:00 p.m. on February 15, so the outage doesn’t affect you.

[Read more about how the Social Security system outage will affect you...](/blog/want-coverage-starting-march-1-plan-ahead-for-best-results/)


##[Thursday, January 16: HealthCare.gov moving forward](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2014/01/healthcare-gov-moving-forward.html) 
We're pleased that HealthCare.gov has helped millions of Americans access health care, but our work is not over. And we're keeping our eye on the ball to make sure that the website works well -- and steadily improves -- as we invite new consumers to sign up for affordable, quality health coverage in the months ahead. 

[Read more about how HealthCare.gov is moving forward...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2014/01/healthcare-gov-moving-forward.html)

##[Friday, December 27: Meeting the mark](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/12/healthcare-gov-meeting-the-mark.html) 
HealthCare.gov is meeting the mark and helping Americans from across the country find secure, quality health insurance coverage at an affordable price. We’ve seen important progress and we are going to keep working to make sure the consumer experience continues to improve throughout the open enrollment period. 

[Read more about our recent progress and see consumer tips on using Marketplace coverage...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/12/healthcare-gov-meeting-the-mark.html)

##[Tuesday, December 24: Completing enrollments for consumers seeking January 1 coverage](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/12/interest-signing-up-for-january-1-coverage.html) 
HealthCare.gov received a remarkable 2 million site visits and our call center received more than 250,000 calls on December 23rd. We're working to complete enrollments for consumers seeking affordable coverage beginning January 1. If you tried to enroll before the deadline and had problems with the system, you should contact the Marketplace call center for individual assistance. 

[Read more about what you should do if you had trouble enrolling before the deadline...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/12/interest-signing-up-for-january-1-coverage.html)

##[Monday, December 23: A record day for HealthCare.gov and consumers](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/12/last-day-sign-up-for-january-1.html) 
The system handled a record number of consumers who completed their enrollments with a low overall error rate averaging less than 0.4 percent and quick response times averaging well less than a second despite the increased traffic.

[Read more about the record traffic and see consumer tips on completing your enrollment...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/12/last-day-sign-up-for-january-1.html)

##[Saturday, December 14: Missing 834s as percentage of enrollment now near zero](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/12/missing-834s-percentage-now-near-zero.html)
We're working to make sure that every 834 form – past and present – is accurate, and that consumers are able to successfully enroll in the coverage of their choice.

[Read more about 834 creation and accuracy...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/12/missing-834s-percentage-now-near-zero.html)

##[Friday, December 6: Weekly metrics report](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/12/healthcare-gov-gets-3.7-million-visitors-this-week.html)
More than 3.7 million consumers visited HealthCare.gov this week to learn about their health insurance options, create an account, learn about financial help, compare options, and select a plan.

You can now see more detailed information about each Marketplace plan offered in your area before you apply. Compare plans, covered benefits, physician and hospital networks, and more. No login or application is required to access this new window shopping tool.

[Read more about improved window shopping on HealthCare.gov…](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/12/window-shopping-healthcare-gov.html)

We’ve provided weekly reports until now and want to highlight our work as we begin December – detailing the measurable improvements we’ve made to HealthCare.gov and acknowledging that more work remains to be done.

[Read more about our progress and download the report…](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/12/operational-progress-report.html)

##[Saturday, November 30: Weekend work continues](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/weekend-work-continues.html)
This weekend's maintenance windows allowed additional hardware upgrades and software fixes as part of a planned set of improvements to improve speed and reduce errors.

[Read more about this weekend's improvements to HealthCare.gov...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/weekend-work-continues.html)

##[Wednesday, November 27: Hundreds of improvements](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/hundreds-of-improvements.html)
We've increased capacity and made software fixes that will greatly enhance the ability of consumers to use HealthCare.gov to shop for and enroll in health plans that meet their needs.

[Read more about our ongoing efforts to make improvements to HealthCare.gov...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/hundreds-of-improvements.html)

##[Monday, November 25: Adding additional capacity](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/adding-capacity.html)
Over the weekend, we implemented software fixes focused on enhancing the user experience, improving enrollment, and streamlining the workflow for agents, brokers and call center representatives. [Read more about our recent improvements...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/adding-capacity.html)

##[Friday, November 22: Progress on capacity](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/progress-on-capacity.html)
HealthCare.gov will work smoothly for the vast majority of users by the end of November. We're making progress: Average response time is now under 1 second, the error rate is less than 1%, and we're making upgrades to double capacity so we can support more simultaneous users. 

[Read more about progress on capacity...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/progress-on-capacity.html)

##[Thursday, November 21: Ongoing software fixes improve user experience](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/software-fixes-improve-user-experience.html)
Last night, we added several dozen software fixes that address key functions of the website. These fixes improved user experience, the enrollment process, and the workflow for agents, brokers, and call center representatives.

[Read more about the ongoing software fixes...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/software-fixes-improve-user-experience.html)

##[Tuesday, November 19: Making the enrollment process easier](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/enrollment-process-easier.html)
We’ve completed fixes for two-thirds of the high priority bugs that our team identified as being responsible for issues with 834 transactions and Direct Enrollment. 

[Read more about making the enrollment process easier...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/enrollment-process-easier.html)

##[Monday, November 18: Progress over the weekend](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/progress-over-weekend.html)
Over the past few weeks, we’ve made measurable progress to improve HealthCare.gov, addressing both software glitches and hardware upgrades–-all of which will make a meaningful difference in the consumer experience.

[Read more about progress over the weekend...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/progress-over-weekend.html)


##[Saturday, November 16: Weekly wrap up](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/weekly-wrap-up.html)
As we continue to improve HealthCare.Gov, we want to provide you with a wrap up of the fixes we’ve made to the site over the last week and give you an update on open enrollment.

[Read more about this week's improvements...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/weekly-wrap-up.html)

##[Friday, November 15: Making measurable progress](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/measurable-progress.html)
We’ve made measurable progress and the changes and improvements we’ve made over the last few weeks are having a positive impact on system performance. We've crossed more than 200 bug fixes off of our punch list and driven the error rate down below 1%.

[Read more about how we're making measurable progress...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/measurable-progress.html)

##[Tuesday, November 12: Improving user experience](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/improving-user-experience.html)
We’ve made substantive progress over the weekend on HealthCare.gov - implementing updates that will improve the user experience, improve system throughput, and streamline the process for agent/brokers and customer service representatives.

[Read more about improving user experience...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/improving-user-experience.html)
##[Saturday, November 9: A progress update](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/healthcare-gov-progress.html)
We've put major fixes in place over the last three weeks, improving site performance. Learn about the fixes, and read the stories of Americans who are successfully finishing their applications using HealthCare.gov.

[Read more about our progress, and Americans' success stories...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/healthcare-gov-progress.html)

##[Friday, November 8: How we're measuring progress](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/healthcare-gov-metrics.html)
Two of the metrics by which we are measuring progress are response time and error rate. Response time is how fast the system responds to user requests. Error rate is a measure of the frequency of system time outs or failures that prevent a user from advancing. We've made meaningful progress against both of these metrics.

[Read more about how we're measuring our progress...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/healthcare-gov-metrics.html)

##[Thursday, November 7: Best practices for improvements](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/best-practices-for-improvement.html)

In addition, QSSI has established a new protocol that will help us make progress on our punch list and continuously improve the functionality and performance of HealthCare.gov.

[Read more about the latest improvements...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/best-practices-for-improvement.html)

##[Wednesday, November 6: An update on HealthCare.gov](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/update-on-healthcare-gov.html)
Overnight, we added a new software release that included dozens of fixes focused on improving the user experience and agent and broker processes. [Read more about the work that was done overnight...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/update-on-healthcare-gov.html)

We've made more than a dozen important fixes to the HealthCare.gov application and enrollment system to improve performance and functionality. This includes fixes to correct information on 834 notices that insurance companies use to process enrollments.

We've made progress this week in crossing items off the punch list, fixing bugs, and improving site performance. HealthCare.gov works better today for users than it did last week and we will continue to measure our progress, hold teams accountable, and drive upgrades to improve the consumer experience.

[Read more about how we're making progress...](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/11/healthcare-gov-progress-update.html)

##[Thursday, October 31: More information on the tech surge](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/10/more-on-the-tech-surge.html)

blog.content:
Todos los días, los consumidores están usando CuidadoDeSalud.gov y los Mercados de seguros estatales en todo el país para solicitar e inscribirse en cobertura médica de calidad y accesible. Más de 3 millones de personas se han inscrito hasta ahora y esperamos que millones más lo hagan antes de que finalice la inscripción abierta el 31 de marzo.

A partir del sábado 15 de febrero 2014 a las 3:00 pm hasta el martes, 18 de febrero 2014 a las 5:00 am (ET), la Administración del Seguro Social llevará a cabo [mantenimiento programado de los sistemas](http://www.ssa.gov/admin/transactions.html) durante un fin de semana de tres días. Durante este período, los servicios para la verificación de datos relacionados no estarán disponibles. Todos los demás servicios estarán funcionando de forma normal.

Lo que esto significa para usted:

**Si ya ha completado su solicitud y sabe para lo que califica:** Esto no le afecta - usted puede seguir buscando y elegir un plan para terminar su inscripción.
<!--more-->
**Si desea que su cobertura comience el 1 de marzo de 2014:** Por lo general, usted tiene que inscribirse antes del 15 de febrero. Pero, a causa del mantenimiento programado, usted no podrá averiguar para lo que califica si solicita cobertura después de las 3:00pm de ese día. Si usted no puede completar su inscripción en línea para el 15 de febrero, llámenos al 1-800-318-2596 comenzando el 18 de febrero para solicitar la cobertura comenzando el 1 de marzo. Vamos a trabajar con usted para que obtenga su cobertura.

**Si desea que su cobertura comience más tarde:** Usted puede llenar su solicitud durante este tiempo, pero no podrá averiguar para lo que califica durante el período de mantenimiento. Cuando complete su solicitud, tendrá que guardarla y volver a CuidadoDeSalud.gov en o después del 18 de febrero saber para lo que califica, elegir un plan y completar su inscripción.

Recuerde, usted tiene hasta el 31 de marzo para obtener nueva cobertura durante el período de inscripción abierta de este año.

blog.page_name: Want coverage starting March 1? Plan ahead for best results
blog.excerpt: Consumers are applying and enrolling in quality, affordable health coverage every day using HealthCare.gov and State-based Marketplaces around the country. More than 3 million have enrolled so far, and we hope millions more will do so by March 31, the end of open enrollment.
blog.content:
Consumers are applying and enrolling in quality, affordable health coverage every day using HealthCare.gov and State-based Marketplaces around the country. More than 3 million have enrolled so far, and we hope millions more will do so by March 31, the end of open enrollment.

From Saturday February 15, 2014 at 3:00PM until Tuesday, February 18, 2014 at 5:00AM EST, the Social Security Administration will conduct required, [regularly scheduled systems maintenance activities](http://www.ssa.gov/admin/transactions.html) over the three day weekend. During this period, verification of Social Security Numbers and other related data via the Data Services Hub will be unavailable. All other services of the Hub will be functioning as normal.  
<!--more-->
What this means for you:

**If you have already completed your application and know what you qualify for:** This doesn’t affect you -- you can continue shopping and pick a plan to finish your enrollment.

**If you want coverage effective March 1, 2014:** You generally need to sign up by February 15. But, because of the maintenance window, you won’t be able to find out what you qualify for if you apply after 3pm that day. If you aren’t able to complete your enrollment online by February 15, call us at 1-800-318-2596 starting on February 18 to request coverage beginning on March 1. We will work with you to get you covered.

**If you want coverage with a later effective date:** You can complete your application during this time but won’t be able to find out what you qualify for during the maintenance period. When you complete your application, you’ll need to save it and return to HealthCare.gov on or after February 18 to find out what you qualify for, pick a plan, and complete your enrollment.

Remember, you have until March 31 to sign up for new coverage during this year’s open enrollment period.

blog.title: La cobertura del Mercado de seguros significa tranquilidad
blog.meta-title: La cobertura del Mercado de seguros significa tranquilidad
blog.meta-description: El Mercado de Seguros Médicos le ofrece la oportunidad de encontrar cobertura de calidad a un precio razonable. Millones de estadounidenses están obteniendo cobertura, muchos de ellos por primera vez.
blog.seo-keywords: Mercado de Seguros Médicos,  jóvenes, nuevas opciones de cobertura
blog.page_name: La cobertura del Mercado de seguros significa tranquilidad
blog.excerpt: El Mercado de Seguros Médicos le ofrece la oportunidad de encontrar cobertura de calidad a un precio razonable. Millones de estadounidenses están obteniendo cobertura, muchos de ellos por primera vez.
blog.content:
El Mercado de Seguros Médicos le ofrece la oportunidad de encontrar cobertura de calidad a un precio razonable. Millones de estadounidenses están obteniendo cobertura, muchos de ellos por primera vez. 

Más de 3 millones se han inscrito en un seguro de salud privado desde octubre y 6.3 millones fueron clasificados como elegibles para [Medicaid](/es/do-i-qualify-for-medicaid/) o para [el Programa de Seguro Médico para Niños (CHIP en inglés)](/es/are-my-children-eligible-for-chip/). 

Y la mayoría de las personas que soliciten serán elegibles para recibir ayuda con los costos de su cobertura. Casi 6 de cada 10 estadounidenses sin seguro pueden pagar **menos de $100 por mes** por la cobertura del Mercado.

**[Solicite hoy para obtener cobertura que empieza tan pronto como el 1 de marzo.](/es/marketplace/individual/)**
<!--more-->
## Ofreciéndole tranquilidad a las madres

El Mercado le ofrece a las madres tranquilidad y sus familias ya se están beneficiando de los nuevos derechos y protecciones.

- Más de 3 millones de [adultos jóvenes menores de 26 años](/es/can-i-keep-my-child-on-my-insurance-until-age-26/) están cubiertos a través del plan de sus padres. Éstos pueden revisar  nuevas opciones de cobertura en el Mercado al cumplir los 26 años de edad.

- Los adultos jóvenes pueden [ahorrar en los costos de sus primas mensuales](/es/will-i-qualify-to-save-on-monthly-premiums/) o en [los gastos de su bolsillo](/es/will-i-qualify-to-save-on-out-of-pocket-costs/) por un seguro médico privado. Y [planes de cobertura catastrófica](/es/can-i-buy-a-catastrophic-plan/) están disponibles para las personas menores de 30 años de edad. 

- Las compañías de seguros no pueden negarle cobertura a usted o a su familia  debido a una [condición preexistente, como asma, dolor de espalda o cáncer](/es/what-if-i-have-a-pre-existing-health-condition/).

- [Los cuidados preventivos como exámenes de cáncer y métodos anticonceptivos](/es/what-are-my-preventive-care-benefits/) ahora están cubiertos sin gastos de su propio bolsillo. Esto incluye [22 servicios preventivos cubiertos para las mujeres](/es/what-are-my-preventive-care-benefits/#part=2)  y  [25 servicios cubiertos para los niños](/es/what-are-my-preventive-care-benefits/#part=3).

Comparta este blog y [revise la historia (en inglés)](http://www.hhs.gov/healthcare/facts/blog/2014/02/peace-of-mind-for-moms.html) de la Dra. Nancy C. Lee, Directora de la Oficina para la Salud de la Mujer en HHS. Como la mayoría de las madres, ella ha tenido muchas noches sin dormir pensando en sus hijos. Pero gracias al Mercado, una cosa por la cual no tiene que preocuparse es su capacidad de conseguir un buen seguro médico.

blog.title: Marketplace coverage means peace of mind
blog.meta-title: Marketplace coverage means peace of mind
blog.meta-description: The Health Insurance Marketplace is making it easier to find quality, affordable coverage. Millions of Americans are getting covered, many for the first time.
blog.seo-keywords: Health Insurance Marketplace, health insurance, health care, health coverage, peace of mind, coverage for kids, coverage for families,
blog.page_name: Marketplace coverage means peace of mind
blog.content: The Health Insurance Marketplace is making it easier to find quality, affordable coverage. Millions of Americans are getting covered, many for the first time. More than 3 million have enrolled in private health insurance since October and 6.3 million were determined eligible for [Medicaid](/do-i-qualify-for-medicaid) or coverage in the [Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP)](/are-my-children-eligible-for-chip/). And most people who apply will be eligible for help paying for health coverage. Nearly 6 in 10 uninsured Americans can pay **less than $100 per month** for Marketplace coverage. **[Apply today for coverage that can start as soon as March 1st.](/marketplace/individual/)** ## Giving Moms peace of mind The Marketplace is giving Moms peace of mind and families are already benefitting from new rights and protections. - More than 3 million [young adults under age 26](/can-i-keep-my-child-on-my-insurance-until-age-26/) are covered on their parent’s plan. When they turn 26, young adults can shop for new coverage options in the Marketplace. - Young adults may qualify for [lower costs on monthly premiums](/will-i-qualify-to-save-on-monthly-premiums) or [out-of-pocket costs](/will-i-qualify-to-save-on-out-of-pocket-costs) for private insurance. And [catastrophic coverage plans](/can-i-buy-a-catastrophic-plan/) are available if you’re under 30. - Insurances companies can’t deny or drop anyone in your family from coverage because of a [pre-existing condition like asthma, back pain, or cancer](/what-if-i-have-a-pre-existing-health-condition/). - [Preventive care like cancer screenings and contraception](/what-are-my-preventive-care-benefits/) are now covered with no out-of-pocket costs. This includes [22 covered preventive services for women](/what-are-my-preventive-care-benefits/#part=2) and [25 covered services for children](/what-are-my-preventive-care-benefits/#part=3). Share this blog and [check out this story from Dr. Nancy C. Lee](http://www.hhs.gov/healthcare/facts/blog/2014/02/peace-of-mind-for-moms.html), Director of the Office on Women’s Health at HHS. Like most moms, she’s had a lot of sleepless nights worrying about her kids. But thanks to the Marketplace, one thing she no longer has to worry about is their ability to get good health insurance.

blog.title: 6 cosas que debe saber sobre los deducibles en el Mercado de Seguros Médicos
blog.meta-title: 6 cosas que debe saber sobre los deducibles en el Mercado de Seguros Médicos
blog.meta-description: Obtenga más información sobre deducibles y el Mercado de Seguros Médicos. Visite CuidadoDeSalud.gov para solicitar cobertura, comparar los planes e inscribirse.
blog.seo-keywords: Mercado de Seguros Médicos, seguro médico, deducible, gastos de su bolsillo, cuidado preventivo.
blog.excerpt: Es importante considerar los deducibles, primas, coseguro y copagos al momento de elegir un plan de salud. Usted puede comparar los planes y ver si califica para los costos reducidos antes de solicitar. La mayoría de las personas que solicitan serán elegibles para recibir ayuda para pagar su cobertura médica.
blog.content:
Es importante considerar los deducibles, primas, coseguro y copagos al momento de elegir un plan de salud. Usted puede comparar los planes y ver si califica para los costos reducidos antes de solicitar. La mayoría de las personas que solicitan serán elegibles para recibir ayuda para pagar su cobertura médica.

Aquí hay 6 cosas importantes que debe saber sobre los deducibles:
<!--more-->
1. **El tener un seguro médico puede reducir sus costos, incluso cuando tenga que pagar de su bolsillo para cumplir con su deducible.** Las compañías de seguros negocian sus tarifas con los proveedores y usted tendrá que pagar esa cantidad. Las personas no aseguradas pagan, en promedio, el doble por su cuidado.
2. **Un deducible de seguro de médico es diferente a los otros tipos de deducibles.** A diferencia de un deducible para auto, inquilinos, o un seguro de propietarios de viviendas, en la que no recibe servicios hasta que pague su deducible, muchos planes de seguro médico ofrecen algunos beneficios antes de cumplir con el deducible.
3. **Todos los planes del Mercado cubren el cuidado preventivo.** [Exámenes, vacunas y otros servicios preventivos](/es/what-are-my-preventive-care-benefits/) están cubiertos sin necesidad de pagar el deducible. Muchos  seguros médicos cubren también otros beneficios como las visitas al médico y medicamentos recetados, incluso si usted no ha cumplido con su deducible.
4. **En el año 2014, hay un máximo de $6,350 para los [gastos directos de su bolsillo](/es/glossary/out-of-pocket-costs "glossary") para servicios dentro de la red.** El máximo para las familias es $12,700. Incluso si usted elige un [plan catastrófico](/es/can-i-buy-a-catastrophic-plan/) con un alto deducible, los gastos directos de su bolsillo no deben exceder este límite.
5. **Más del 70% de los planes del Mercado tienen deducibles por debajo de $3,000.** Cuando usted [elige un plan de salud](/es/how-do-i-choose-marketplace-insurance/), es importante entender lo que su compañía de seguros cubre sin necesidad de pagar el deducible. A continuación, puede decidir si desea un plan con primas más bajas mensuales y un deducible más alto, o uno con una prima mensual más alta y un deducible más bajo.
6. **Los planes de Plata le pueden ahorrar más.** Si [califica para los costos reducidos de su propio bolsillo](/es/will-i-qualify-to-save-on-out-of-pocket-costs/) y elije un plan de Plata, usted puede ahorrar más con un copago y un deducible más bajo. Si califica, usted obtendrá los beneficios de un plan de Oro o de Platino por el precio del plan de Plata. Usted puede elegir cualquiera de las categorías del plan, pero este ahorro sólo aplicará si se inscribe en un plan de Plata.

blog.title: 6 things to know about deductibles in the Health Insurance Marketplace
blog.meta-title: 6 things to know about deductibles in the Health Insurance Marketplace
blog.meta-description: Learn about deductibles and the Health Insurance Marketplace. Visit HealthCare.gov to apply for coverage, compare plans, and enroll.
blog.seo-keywords: Health Insurance Marketplace, health insurance, deductible, out-of-pocket-costs, preventive care,
blog.page_name: 6 things to know about deductibles in the Health Insurance Marketplace
blog.excerpt:
Deductibles, premiums, copayments, and coinsurance, are important for you to consider when choosing a health insurance plan. You can compare health plans and see if you qualify for lower costs before you apply. Most people who apply will be eligible for help paying for health coverage.

Here are 6 important things to know about deductibles:
blog.content:
Deductibles, premiums, copayments, and coinsurance, are important for you to consider when choosing a health insurance plan. You can [compare health plans and see if you qualify for lower costs](https://www.healthcare.gov/find-premium-estimates/) before you apply. Most people who apply will be eligible for help paying for health coverage.
<!--more-->
Here are 6 important things to know about deductibles:

1. **Having health insurance can lower your costs even when you have to pay out of pocket to meet your deductible.** Insurance companies negotiate their rates with providers and you’ll pay that discounted rate. People without insurance pay, on average, twice as much for care.   
2. **A health insurance deductible is different from other types of deductibles.** Unlike auto, renters, or homeowners insurance, where you don’t get services until you pay your deductible, many health insurance plans provide some benefits before you meet the deductible. 
3. **All Marketplace plans cover preventive care.** [Screenings, immunizations, and other preventive services](/what-are-my-preventive-care-benefits/) are covered without requiring you to pay your deductible. Many health insurance plans also cover other benefits like doctor visits and prescription drugs even if you haven’t met your deductible.
4. **In 2014, there’s a $6,350 maximum for individual [out-of-pocket costs](/glossary/out-of-pocket-costs "glossary") for in-network services.** The maximum for families is $12,700. Even if you choose a high deductible [catastrophic plan](/can-i-buy-a-catastrophic-plan/), your out-of-pocket costs should not exceed this limit.
5. **Over 70% of Marketplace plans have deductibles under $3,000.** When you [choose a health insurance plan](/how-do-i-choose-marketplace-insurance/), it’s important to understand what your insurance company covers without requiring you to pay your deductible. Then you can decide whether you want a plan with lower monthly premiums and a higher deductible, or one with a higher monthly premium and a lower deductible.  
6. **Silver plans can save you more.** If you [qualify for lower out-of-pocket costs](/will-i-qualify-to-save-on-out-of-pocket-costs/) and choose a Silver plan, you can save more with a lower copay and a lower deductible. If you qualify, you'll get the out-of-pocket savings benefits of a Gold or Platinum plan for a Silver plan price. You can choose any category of plan, but these out-of-pocket savings apply only if you enroll in a Silver plan.

blog.content:
Cuando las enfermedades y lesiones nos atacan, el tener un seguro médico puede ser la diferencia entre quedarse o abandonar el juego.  

Lo sé, porque yo estaba en la cima de mi juego - me sentía invencible - pero cuando fui por mi examen físico para mi equipo encontré que tenía una grave enfermedad renal. Afortunadamente la encontraron a tiempo para tratarla y por suerte, estaba asegurado.

Hoy en día las personas no aseguradas en todas las partes del país o las personas que simplemente quieren revisar sus opciones pueden obtener cobertura médica de calidad y a un precio razonable a través del nuevo Mercado de Seguros Médicos.  

A través del Mercado, usted puede comparar los planes de marca y obtener pagos mensuales reducidos. Y lo más importante, como parte de la ley de la salud, los planes médicos tienen que ofrecerle [servicios preventivos](/es/what-are-my-preventive-care-benefits/) como vacunas contra la gripe, la diabetes y exámenes para la presión gratis. Además no hay límites anuales o de por vida en la cobertura. Así que usted puede conseguir el físico que necesita para detectar pequeños problemas antes de que se conviertan en algo serio. Y la cobertura que usted necesita para obtener el cuidado continuo a un precio razonable.
<!--more-->
**[Visite CuidadoDeSalud.gov y revise sus opciones hoy.](https://www.cuidadodesalud.gov/)** 

Cobertura razonable y de calidad está a su alcance. Simplemente [llame, haga clic o hable con alguien](/es/contact-us/).  

Inscríbase hoy y manténgase en el juego.

blog.page_name: Get covered to stay in the game
blog.content: When sickness or injury strike, having health insurance can mean the difference between falling and getting back up and dropping out of the game. I know, because I was at the top of my game - I felt invincible - but when I went for my regular team physical it turned out I had a serious kidney disease. Thankfully it was caught in time to treat it and luckily, I was insured. Today people across the country who are uninsured, or just want to check out their options can get affordable, quality insurance through the new Health Insurance Marketplace. Through the Marketplace, you can compare brand name plans and even get lower monthly payments. And importantly, as part of the health care law, health insurance plans have to offer [preventive services](/what-are-my-preventive-care-benefits/) like flu shots, diabetes and blood pressure screenings for free. Plus there are no annual or lifetime caps on coverage. So you too can get the physical you need to catch small problems before they become big ones. And the coverage you need to get ongoing care without breaking the bank. **[Visit HealthCare.gov today to look at your options.](https://www.healthcare.gov/)** Quality, affordable coverage is just a [call, click or conversation away](/contact-us/). You have until March 31 to sign up. Enroll today so you can stay in the game.

blog.content:
Desde el 1ro de octubre, más de 6 millones de personas se han inscrito en un plan médico a través del Mercado de seguros o en Medicaid. 

Si usted ha llenado la solicitud y ha escogido un plan en el Mercado de seguros, para asegurarse de que su cobertura entre comience, tal vez le queden algunas cosas por hacer. Lo más importante es que pague la prima correspondiente al primer mes a tiempo. Siga las instrucciones de su seguro sobre cómo y cuándo hacer el primer pago y la fecha de vencimiento. También debe comunicarse con el plan que ha escogido para confirmar su inscripción.  

Y, recuerde que aún está a tiempo de inscribirse en un plan y conseguir cobertura médica de calidad. [Inscríbase hoy para que su cobertura comience el  1ro de febrero](/es/marketplace/individual/).

Si tiene preguntas sobre la cobertura, puede llamarnos al 1-800-318-2596 (TTY: 1-855-889-4325). Nuestros representantes están disponibles en el Centro de llamadas del Mercado de seguros las 24 horas del día, los 7 días de la semana. También ofrecemos varios [consejos para el consumidor en HealthCare.gov](/es/using-your-new-marketplace-coverage/) para ayudarle a entender la cobertura nueva. 
<!--more-->
Gracias al Mercado de seguros, millones de estadounidenses ahora están asegurados y tienen acceso a los servicios médicos, muchos de ellos por primera vez. Hemos estado trabajando arduamente para que la transición a la cobertura sea lo menos complicada que sea posible, especialmente para aquellos que están obteniendo un seguro médico por primera vez. 

Estamos dedicados con nuestros socios, entre los que se incluyen los estados, a atender los asuntos relacionados con la transición eficazmente, y queremos agradecerles a los planes, farmacias, organizaciones de proveedores y otros por su flexibilidad durante el período de transición, y por haber movilizado sus redes para ofrecer asistencia a los consumidores que tuvieran preguntas o dudas.  

A medida que avanzamos en el proceso, continuamos trabajando para asegurarnos de que  todo estadounidense que desee obtener la cobertura a través del Mercado de seguros para el 31de marzo de 2014, cuando termina la inscripción abierta pueda hacerlo, y de ese modo gozar de la seguridad y tranquilidad que le brinda el saber que tienen cobertura médica de calidad.

blog.content:
Since October 1st, more than 6 million people have enrolled in coverage through the Health Insurance Marketplace or Medicaid.  

If you’ve completed an application and chosen a plan on the Marketplace, you may still need to take a couple of steps in order to ensure that your coverage takes effect. Most important, you need to pay your first month’s premium on time. Follow the instructions from your insurer about how and when to make your premium payment and the due date. You should also [contact the plan you selected](http://marketplace.cms.gov/getofficialresources/publications-and-articles/contact-health-plan.pdf) to confirm that enrollment has, in fact, taken place.
<!--more-->
And, remember, there’s still time to enroll in quality health coverage. [Sign-up today for coverage that begins February 1st](/marketplace/individual/).

If you have a question about coverage, you can contact us at 1-800-318-2596 (TTY: 1-855-889-4325). Our trained representatives are available at the Marketplace Call Center 24 hours a day 7 days a week if you need help. And we’ve also developed a number of [consumer tips on HealthCare.gov](/using-your-new-marketplace-coverage/) to help you understand your new coverage.  

Thanks to the Marketplace, millions of Americans have health insurance and access to care — many for the first time. We’ve been working hard to make the transition to coverage as smooth as possible, particularly for those getting coverage for the first time.  

We’ve engaged with our partners, including the states, to handle coverage transition issues effectively, and we want to thank the plans, pharmacies, provider organizations and others who have shown such flexibility during the transition period and who mobilized their networks to assist during this time and to effectively engage with consumers who may have questions. 

As we now move forward, we’re continuing to work to ensure that every American who wants to enroll in Marketplace coverage by the end of the open enrollment period on March 31st, 2014, is able to do so — and so enjoy the security and peace of mind that comes with having quality health coverage.

blog.excerpt: For millions of Americans quality, affordable coverage is just around the corner. And making sure people know about the new options available to them, and providing a smooth transition to this new day for coverage is our top priority
blog.content:
For millions of Americans quality, affordable coverage is just around the corner.  And making sure people know about the new options available to them, and providing a smooth transition to this new day for coverage is our top priority

## Providing a smooth transition

We’ve taken a number of steps to help you:

1.	You now have [more time to enroll and pay your premium](/how-to-have-the-best-experience-with-healthcare-gov/#part=5)
2.	We’ve improved the [window shopping experience](https://www.healthcare.gov/find-premium-estimates/) on HealthCare.gov
3.	[PCIP enrollees can continue their coverage](/coverage/pre-existing-conditions/) through January 2014. 
<!--more-->
We’re also working with insurance companies to ensure that [consumers with cancelled plans](/what-if-my-current-individual-plan-is-changing-or-not-being-offered-in-2014/) don’t have a gap in coverage starting January 1. We’re providing additional resources for you if your individual insurance policy has been cancelled.  

## Resources for consumers with cancelled plans
 
If you or someone you know have received a cancellation letter, here’s what you should know:  
 
-	You can **call 1-866-837-0677**, a new hotline dedicated to consumers with cancelled policies. A representative will help you find coverage that begins in 2014. They can explain the options available for replacing or renewing a cancelled plan. You can call between 9 a.m. and 7 p.m. EST Monday through Friday and between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. on Saturday, and Sunday.
-	If the plans available in the Marketplace are unaffordable, you may be eligible for a “hardship” exemption, which will allow you to buy [catastrophic coverage](/can-i-buy-a-catastrophic-plan/). 
-	To buy this coverage, [complete a hardship exemption form](/exemptions/), and indicate that your policy has been cancelled and that you believe the Marketplace options in your area are unaffordable.  
-	You will then need to provide this form along with a copy of your cancellation notice to an insurance company offering catastrophic coverage in your area and apply directly with them. The hotline can help with questions about this option.

We are working around the clock to make sure that anyone who wants coverage starting on January 1 can get it. And don’t forget that you have until March 31 to sign up for coverage effective in 2014. 

Coverage is a call, click, or conversation away. We’re inviting Americans who do not have employer-based insurance to [learn about their new options in the Health Insurance Marketplace](https://www.healthcare.gov/) at HealthCare.gov.  

Remember to [pay your premium to your insurance company by December 31st or any later date](/how-to-have-the-best-experience-with-healthcare-gov/#part=5) set by your insurer in order to have coverage that is effective January 1, 2014.

blog.seo-keywords: HealthCare.gov, window shopping, browse plans, enrollment, making improvements, Health Insurance Marketplace,
blog.meta-title: New and more robust HealthCare.gov tools to help you enroll
blog.meta-description: We’ve made many improvements over the last eight weeks to help you complete your enrollment. Learn about new features available on HealthCare.gov.
blog.page_name: New and more robust HealthCare.gov tools to help you enroll
blog.excerpt: Welcome back to the Health Insurance Marketplace! We’ve made many improvements over the last eight weeks to help you complete your enrollment.
blog.content:
Welcome back to the Health Insurance Marketplace! We’ve made many improvements over the last eight weeks to help you complete your enrollment.  

Here are some of the new features you’ll find on HealthCare.gov:

**More robust window shopping.** You can now see detailed information about each Marketplace health insurance plan offered in your area before you apply. This new tool will allow you to see plan prices displayed much more accurately, based on the household information you supply. You can compare plans, covered benefits, physician and hospital networks, and more. No login or application required. Just answer a few simple questions to [see plans and prices in your area](https://www.healthcare.gov/find-premium-estimates/). You will still need to complete the application to find out how you can get lower costs, but this is a much enhanced version of earlier information and one more way you can get the information you need to help you get ready to enroll and find a plan that fits your needs and budget. 
<!--more-->
**You can remove problem applications.** If you’ve experienced problems filling out your online application, you can start over with a brand new application. To do this, you’ll first need to log in to your account; select your current application; and then choose to “Remove” the application. You will then need to close out your web page and then log back in using your same account. You can then start a brand new application.

**Get help enrolling online, on the phone, or in person.** You can get help where and when you need it. For example: You can start an application online and then call 1-800-318-2596 (TTY: 1 855-889-4325) 24 hours a day, 7 days a week to get help enrolling over the phone. You can also find in–person help from certified assisters in your area. Just [enter your zip code](https://localhelp.healthcare.gov/) to get started. 

**You can apply offline and continue your enrollment online.** If you submitted a paper application or applied over the phone, you can create a Marketplace account to pull up your eligibility determination and complete your enrollment. To do this, you’ll need your application identification number, and you can [contact the call center](/contact-us/) to get it if you don’t know it.
 
**Direct enrollment in a Marketplace plan.** Many insurers are now offering the opportunity for you to [enroll directly](http://www.hhs.gov/healthcare/facts/blog/2013/11/direct-enrollment.html) in a Marketplace plan with that company, whether through the insurance company’s website, an agent or broker, or an online health insurance seller.

These new functionality improvements are in addition to the hardware and software improvements we’ve made over the past eight weeks to improve the consumer experience, increase capacity, and ensure that you can successfully move through the entire enrollment process. 

We’ll continue to [make improvements](/blog/how-we-are-working-to-improve-healthcare-gov/) to HealthCare.gov in the weeks and months ahead, and we encourage you to come back and explore your new coverage options. You have until December 23 to enroll in health coverage that can start as soon as January 1, 2014, and the Marketplace Open Enrollment period runs until March 31, 2014. Here are some [shopping tips](http://www.hhs.gov/healthcare/facts/blog/2013/11/holiday-shopping-tips.html) to get you started.

blog.seo-keywords: Health Insurance Marketplace, Marketplace account, create an account, apply for coverage, Obamacare sign up,

blog.excerpt: We know that the initial consumer experience has been frustrating for many of you. We're committed to making things better and providing the help and health coverage you need.
blog.content:
We know that the initial consumer experience has been frustrating for many of you. We're committed to making things better and providing the help and health coverage you need.

In particular, many people told us they had problems creating their Marketplace accounts – that things got “stuck” somewhere along the way and they never got across the finish line. We’re working hard to fix all of the technical problems on HealthCare.gov and we can report that most users are now able to successfully create online Marketplace accounts. 

You’ll know if you had problems with your account if you never got to see a big “SUCCESS” screen. Maybe the security questions froze, or you never got an email with a verification link, or the email link didn’t work. If this sounds like your experience, now is the time to try again to create a Marketplace account.  
<!--more-->
These 3 tips can help you. 

- If you haven’t received your account verification email, check your inbox and your spam folder for an email from us with the subject line “**Marketplace account created**.”

- If you’re having trouble creating an account, we have reset email addresses in our system to clear out any problems. So go ahead and try again using your email address.

- If pages appear to load slowly, please be patient. Sometimes, it helps to clear out the web browser’s history and cache, close the browser completely and try again. [See browser-specific instructions and other tips](/help/i-am-having-trouble-logging-in-to-my-marketplace-account/).

And remember we're still [working to make even more improvements](/blog/how-we-are-working-to-improve-healthcare-gov/) to the overall online experience at HealthCare.gov. More and more people every day are successfully getting coverage online.  

You have until December 23 to sign up for health coverage that will start as soon as January 1, 2014. And the Marketplace Open Enrollment period runs until March 31, 2014.

blog.title: We’re listening — and improving every day
blog.meta-title: How we're improving the Health Insurance Marketplace
blog.meta-description: The Health Insurance Marketplace is improving based on your feedback. Visit HealthCare.gov to see all of your options and apply.
blog.seo-keywords: Health Insurance Marketplace, health insurance, improving the Health Insurance Marketplace,
blog.page_name: We’re listening — and improving every day
blog.excerpt: We know using HealthCare.gov has been frustrating for many Americans. The initial consumer experience of HealthCare.gov has not lived up to the expectations of the American people. We are committed to doing better.
blog.content:
We know using HealthCare.gov has been frustrating for many Americans. The initial consumer experience of HealthCare.gov has not lived up to the expectations of the American people. We are [committed to doing better](http://www.hhs.gov/digitalstrategy/blog/2013/10/making-healthcare-gov-better.html).

We’ve been gathering feedback since the day we launched – from our customer service representatives, social media channels, and through hundreds of thousands of online surveys and comments. And we’re listening. 

We’ve been making changes to respond directly to your feedback and will continue to do so. A few of our most important changes so far: 
<!--more-->
* You can now [preview plans and prices](/find-premium-estimates/) available in your area without filling out the online application. 
* You can find out, with an [improved calculator](/how-can-i-get-an-estimate-of-costs-and-savings-on-marketplace-health-insurance/), whether your income and household size may qualify you for lower costs on your monthly premiums and out-of-pocket costs.
* [You can apply for coverage 4 ways](/how-do-i-apply-for-marketplace-coverage/): By phone, online, by mail with a paper application, or with the help of an in-person assister.
* We’ve been adding educational online content where you tell us you need more information: About estimating your income, accounting for people in your household, eligibility rules, and more.

And please keep the feedback coming – on this blog post below, on any of our social media pages, or by using the little “Was this page helpful?” survey that appears near the bottom of most pages on the site. 

We won’t rest until every American who needs affordable, high-quality coverage can get it - using whatever method works best for them.

blog.content:
[![4 ways to apply for Marketplace coverage](/assets/4-ways-to-apply.png)](/how-do-i-apply-for-marketplace-coverage/)

Open enrollment in the Health Insurance Marketplace is here and we’re working hard to help you get covered. We’re making improvements to HealthCare.gov and more people are applying and getting covered every day. 

## How to apply for Marketplace coverage
<!--more-->
There are 4 ways to apply for coverage in the Health Insurance Marketplace:

- **Apply online.** Visit [this page](/marketplace/individual/) and select your state to get started.
-	**Apply by phone.** Call 1-800-318-2596 to apply for a health insurance plan and enroll over the phone. (TTY: 1-855-889-4325)
-	**Apply in person.** Visit a trained counselor in your community to get information, apply, and enroll in person. 
-	**Apply by mail.** Complete a paper application and mail it in.

Get [details on all 4 ways to apply](/how-do-i-apply-for-marketplace-coverage/). 

Here’s [what you need to know]( /get-covered-a-1-page-guide-to-the-health-insurance-marketplace/) about the Marketplace before you apply. You can [use this calculator](/how-can-i-get-an-estimate-of-costs-and-savings-on-marketplace-health-insurance/) to see if you qualify for lower costs on coverage and [preview Marketplace plans and prices](/how-much-will-marketplace-insurance-cost/) before you start your application.

El período de inscripción abierta en el Mercado de seguros se aproxima.

1.	[Encuentre el Mercado en su estado y obtenga información y sus opciones](/es/quick-answers/).
2.	[Regístrese para obtener correos electrónicos y actualizaciones por texto del Mercado](/es/subscribe) y [comuníquese con nosotros a través de las redes sociales](/es/connect/).

Use [esta lista de verificación](https://marketplace.cms.gov/outreach-and-education/marketplace-application-checklist-spanish.pdf) ahora para ayudarle a reunir la información que necesita.

8.	Pregúntele a su empleador si piensa ofrecer cobertura médica en 2014. Si usted no tiene cobertura, tendrá que pagar una [multa](/es/what-if-someone-doesnt-have-health-coverage-in-2014). 
9.	Aprenda cómo obtener ayuda con su solicitud del Mercado. [Visite Encuentre Ayuda Local]( https://ayudalocal.cuidadodesalud.gov/es/) para obtener ayuda en su área.
10.	[Obtenga ayuda con sus preguntas del Mercado](/es/contact-us/). Llame al 1-800-318-2596, 24 horas al día, 7 días a la semana. Los usuarios de TTY deben llamar al 1-855-889-4325. Chat en vivo también disponible 24/7.

2.	[Sign up for email or text updates about the Marketplace](/subscribe) and [connect with us on social media](/connect/). 
3.	Gather basic information about your household income to see if you [qualify for lower costs on Marketplace coverage](/how-can-i-save-money-on-marketplace-coverage/). Use [this checklist](https://marketplace.cms.gov/outreach-and-education/marketplace-application-checklist.pdf) to get started.
4.	Set your budget and [estimate your costs and savings in the Marketplace](/blog/calculating-your-costs-and-savings-in-the-health-insurance-marketplace/).
5.	Make sure you understand how coverage works, including things like premiums, [deductibles](/glossary/deductible), [out-of-pocket maximums](/glossary/out-of-pocket-maximum-limit), [copayments](/glossary/co-payment), and [coinsurance](/glossary/co-insurance). 
6.	Learn about the [different types of health coverage](/what-are-the-different-types-of-health-insurance). 
7.	Explore your current options. You may be able to [get coverage that starts before January 1, 2014](/coverage-outside-open-enrollment/special-enrollment-period/) through existing programs. 
8.	Ask your employer if it plans to offer health insurance in 2014. If you don’t have coverage, you may have to [pay a fine](/what-if-someone-doesnt-have-health-coverage-in-2014/).
9.	Learn how to get help with your Marketplace application. [Visit LocalHelp.HealthCare.gov](https://localhelp.healthcare.gov/) to find help in your area. 
10.	[Get help with a Marketplace question](/contact-us/). You can call 1-800-318-2596, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. TTY users should call 1-855-889-4325. Online chat is also available 24/7.

blog.content:
[![How the Marketplace works: Create an account, apply, pick a plan, and enroll!](/assets/how-the-marketplace-works-blog.PNG)](/es/marketplace/individual/)

Usted puede solicitar cobertura médica, comparar todas sus opciones e inscribirse en un plan con una solicitud simplificada a través del mercado de Seguro de Salud.
Cuando la inscripción abierta comience el 1 de octubre, usted podrá [llenar su solicitud](/es/marketplace/individual/) y ver las opciones de cobertura disponibles para usted.

## 1. Abra una cuenta
Provea cierta información básica. Después, seleccione un nombre de usuario, contraseña y preguntas de seguridad para mayor protección.
## 2. Solicite cobertura del Mercado
Provea información sobre usted y su familia, incluyendo sus ingresos, tamaño del hogar, y mucho más. [Use esta lista de verificación](https://marketplace.cms.gov/outreach-and-education/marketplace-application-checklist-spanish.pdf) ahora para ayudarle a reunir la información que necesita.
## 3. Escoja un plan
A continuación verá todos los planes y programas para los que es elegible y podrá [compararlos](/es/blog/how-to-find-the-health-insurance-plan-that-s-right-for-you/). También sabrá si es elegible para los [costos reducidos de cobertura del Mercado](/es/blog/calculating-your-costs-and-savings-in-the-health-insurance-marketplace/).  
<!--more-->
## 4. Inscríbase
¡Escoja un plan que se ajuste a sus necesidades e inscríbase! La cobertura empieza tan pronto como el 1 enero de 2014.

Si necesita [ayuda con la solicitud del Mercado](/es/blog/how-to-get-help-with-your-marketplace-application/), hay personas capacitadas y certificadas en cada estado para ayudarle a entender sus opciones de cobertura médica e inscribirse en un plan. Y recuerde que puede [comunicarse con nosotros en cualquier momento por teléfono o vía chat en vivo](/es/contact-us/) para obtener ayuda con sus preguntas del Mercado.
